issue.title: Proposal: Set COLORTERM variable to advertise 24-bit support
issue.body:
Set `COLORTERM` to `truecolor` in order for applications to be able to
detect that alacritty supports 24-bit colors.

See https://gist.github.com/XVilka/8346728 for more details.

closes #1526

issue.title: Different color scheme in Alacritty
issue.body:
The color scheme works well in LXTerminal, but in Alacritty where the color scheme becomes slightly reduced.

![ss](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8542502/44616943-37326880-a884-11e8-9e6c-d54cb8114a0d.png)

Default:

![ss2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8542502/44616944-37caff00-a884-11e8-90db-c002bb505481.png)

In the default theme, the orange and magenta color is also reduced.

issue.title: COLORTERM=lilyterm is not detected by programs, we should set to “truecolor”

repository.name: LilyTerm
repository.description: A lightweight, but functional terminal emulator

issue.body:
https://github.com/Tetralet/LilyTerm/blob/faf1254f46049edfb1fd6e9191e78b1b23b9c51d/src/notebook.c#L167

COLORTERM is a semi-standardized variable to signal the program whether the terminal emulator has true color support.

See https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/issues/1526
and the linked writeup https://gist.github.com/XVilka/8346728.

@mueslix researched a lot into these things, and he said: “>90% set the variables to "truecolor" (konsole, gnome-terminal, iterm, kitty, alacritty, .....)”
 
 cc @morhetz who added this in https://github.com/Tetralet/LilyTerm/commit/8e53a9927450f041f524e0e86cfd05998edce2bc

issue.title: Set the COLORTERM environment variable to 'truecolor' to advertise 24-bit color support

repository.name: wezterm
repository.description: A GPU-accelerated cross-platform terminal emulator and multiplexer written by @wez and implemented in Rust

issue.body:
The title is hopefully descriptive enough. 

An [identical feature request](https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/issues/1526) for `alacritty` was implemented sometime ago: 

>A lot of other terminals (terminator, iTerm2, konsole, hyper, ...) set the COLORTERM environment variable to truecolor to indicate that the terminal supports it (see https://gist.github.com/XVilka/8346728 for more details).
>
>It is not a really great solution (it can fail if you start a terminal from another terminal, for example), but apparently there is currently no other standard.
>
>I would therefore propose that alacritty sets COLORTERM=truecolor in order for application developers to detect whether or not the terminal supports it.

See this [commit](https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/commit/35ea0cded20aac5fa40859a22b95979d15018c51) which implements this for `alacritty`. Another example for qterminal is [here](https://github.com/lxqt/qterminal/issues/595).

Wezterm users have to currently hardcode this environment variable & value string in their `config.lua` file. See [this example config](https://github.com/wez/wezterm/issues/292) in an issues filed in this repo. This shouldn't be necessary at all since Wezterm is capable of 24-bit colors, it should proudly advertise it (and leave it up to various programs to use or discard it).

issue.title: [Feature]: Set the COLORTERM environment variable to "truecolor" to advertise 24bit color support.

repository.name: waveterm
repository.description: An open-source, cross-platform terminal for seamless workflows

issue.body:
### Feature description

I think it would be nice to set COLORTERM='truecolor' to advertise that the terminal supports 24bit color. 

Here are similar feature requests in alacritty and wezterm:
https://github.com/wezterm/wezterm/issues/875
https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/issues/1526

### Implementation Suggestion

_No response_

### Anything else?

_No response_
